sn48.71-82:4.1: “Mendicants, the Ganges river slants, slopes, and inclines to the east.
sn48.71-82:4.2: In the same way, a mendicant developing and cultivating the five faculties slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.
sn48.71-82:4.4: It’s when a mendicant develops the faculties of faith, energy,
sn48.71-82:4.7: and wisdom, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
sn48.71-82:4.8: That’s how a mendicant developing and cultivating the five faculties slants, slopes, and inclines to extinguishment.” (To be expanded as in SN 45.92–102)
sn48.71-82:7.1: Six on slanting to the east,
sn48.71-82:7.2: and six on slanting to the ocean;
sn48.71-82:7.4: and that’s how this chapter is recited.
